item.title: Pecos Cleans Up
item.description: Pecos è qui: prega e muori is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Maurizio Lucidi.

item.title: Requiem for a Gringo
item.description: Requiem for a Gringo is a 1968 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Eugenio Martín and José Luis Merino and starring Lang Jeffries, Fernando Sancho and Femi Benussi. It is most known for the gore and psychedelic elements. It is the only western film of the Eurospy and peplum film genre star Lang Jeffries. The film is partially based on Masaki Kobayashi's film Harakiri.

item.title: Death Rides Along
item.description: Death Rides Along is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuseppe Vari.

item.title: Beyond the Law
item.description: Beyond the Law is a 1968 Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Stegani and starring Lee Van Cleef as Cudlip, Antonio Sabàto Sr. as Ben Novack and Gordon Mitchell as Burton. It was first distributed in the United States in 1971.

item.title: I Am Sartana, Trade Your Guns for a Coffin
item.description: Sartana's Here… Trade Your Pistol for a Coffin is a 1970 spaghetti western that is the third of the Sartana film series with George Hilton taking over the lead role from Gianni Garko. The film was shot in Italy and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Per 100.000 dollari ti ammazzo
item.description: Per 100.000 dollari ti ammazzo is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film. It represents the directorial debut film of Giovanni Fago. On the set of this film Gianni Garko got to know Susanna Martinkova, a Czechoslovakian actress at her debut in an Italian production, who little later married the actor and had a daughter with him.

item.title: Django the Bastard
item.description: Django the Bastard, also known as The Strangers Gundown, is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Sergio Garrone. This Gothic-themed Spaghetti Western took advantage of the success of Sergio Corbucci's film Django, hence its title. A similar spaghetti western is the 1967 film Django Kill.

item.title: Jonny Madoc rechnet ab
item.description: Jonny Madoc rechnet ab ist der Titel eines 1967 entstandenen Italowesterns, der die Titelfigur aus dem Film Jonny Madoc erneut in den Mittelpunkt stellt. Wieder inszenierte Maurizio Lucidi den Amerikaner Robert Woods in der Hauptrolle. Der Film lief am 8. Dezember 1967 erstmals in Kinos des deutschsprachigen Raums.

item.title: Requiem für Django
item.description: Requiem für Django ist ein spanisch koproduzierter Italowestern, den José Luis Merino 1968 inszenierte. Der von der Kritik mittelmäßig aufgenommene Film wurde in Deutschland in einer um fast 20 Minuten gekürzten Version erstmals am 20. Juni 1969 aufgeführt.

item.title: Tödlicher Ritt nach Sacramento
item.description: Tödlicher Ritt nach Sacramento ist ein 1967 entstandener Italowestern von Giuseppe Vari. Der Film war im deutschsprachigen Raum auch unter dem Kurztitel Tödlicher Ritt und nur in einer erheblich geschnittenen Version zu sehen; im Kino lief er erst Jahre nach seinem Entstehen, am 25. April 1975, an.
